STEP0_DESCRIPTION:
Vielen Dank, dass ihr am openSenseMap Projekt teilnehmen und eine eigene Messstation oder senseBox registrieren wollt. Vor der Registrierung wollen wir Euch kurz sagen, welche persönlichen Daten wir speichern.

Bei der Registrierung müsst ihr euren Namen, eine gültige E-Mail Adresse und den Standort eurer senseBox angeben.

Die E-Mail Adresse wird genutzt um euch den Arduino Sketch zu schicken und euch unregelmäßig über Neuigkeiten zu informieren. Die E-Mail Adresse wird nicht an Drittanbieter weitergegeben und kann auch nicht von Anderen eingesehen werden.

Der Standort wird genutzt um auf einer Karte zu zeigen, wo sich die senseBox physikalisch befindet. Diese Information ist wichtig um die Einflüsse des Aufstellungsortes in die Messwerte einfließen zu lassen. Der Standort ist zusammen mit dem von dir gewählten Namen deiner Station für jeden einsehbar oder kann über die API abgerufen werden.

Alle Daten werden auf einem Server bei Amazon Web Services (AWS) gespeichert. Der Server befindet sich physikalisch in der Region Frankfurt in Deutschland. Weitere Informationen zu AWS Regionen findet ihr hier.
STEP1_DESCRIPTION: Please submit your name and a valid email address, so that after registration we can send you the source code for your senseBox.
STEP1_EMAIL_INFO: If you choose not to provide a valid email address, you will only be able to download your senseBox sketch using your API key. It will be displayed at the end of the registration.
STEP2_SUB1_DESCRIPTION: Please submit additional information about your senseBox. This information can be changed after registration as well.
STEP2_SUB2_DESCRIPTION: Click on the map to choose a location for your senseBox.
MQTT_DESCRIPTION: openSenseMap offers a MQTT client for connecting to public brokers. Documentation for the parameters is provided in the docs. Please note that it's only possible to receive measurements through MQTT.
MQTT_INVALID_URL: The URL scheme is not correct! The URL must start with mqtt[s]://.
STEP3_DESCRIPTION: To finish registering your senseBox, click "Finish" and you will receive an email with instructions on how to assemble your senseBox and how to upload your code onto it. If you have changed your mind, click "Cancel" and you will be redirected back to the overview map.
REGISTRATION_SUCCESS: Your senseBox was successully created. Soon you will receive an email with all information and your senseBox sketch.
REGISTRATION_FAIL: There was an error creating your senseBox in the system. Please try again later.
SETTINGS_IMAGE_RESTRICTIONS: Only PNG, JPG, JPEG files are allowed up to a max. size of 500 KB
PLEASE_SPECIFY_STATIONNAME: Please specify a name for your station
PLEASE_SPECIFY_GROUPID: Optional prefix for groups of senseBoxes
REGISTRATION_LICENSE: By clicking "Finish" you agree that the sensor data you submit can be freely used by the public according to the Public Domain Dedication and License 1.0.
Name: Name
INFO_MADE_BY:

Map tiles courtesy of Mapbox

INFO_ABOUT:
openSenseMap is a platform for open sensor data at which everyone can participate in.
This project started in 2015 at the GI@School lab at the Institute for Geoinformatics in Münster, where it is used together with senseBox to educate pupils and citizens, and offer them a platform for sharing sensor data.

This website and the data API are open source software, suggestions for improvement are always welcome.
EDITBOX_INFO: To change the settings of your senseBox please enter your senseBox API-Key
EDITBOX_APIKEYISSUE: It looks like that API key is wrong, please try again
EDITBOX_SAVEERROR: An error occured when saving the box, please try again later
EDITBOX_EDITABLE: You can now change the details and image of your senseBox. When you are finished click Save.
EDITBOX_DOWNLOADSCRIPTLINK: Click here to retrieve your script
EDIT_SCRIPT_MANUAL: A guided instruction including the upload of the sketch is available here: senseBox:home Book (english)
EDIT_SCRIPT_DOWNLOAD_RESOURCES: You can download the latest senseBox arduino libraries here.
EDIT_CHANGESENSORSINFO: Data measured by sensors that you are going to delete will be deleted as well. If you add new sensors, don't forget to retrieve your new script (see tab 'Script').
EDIT_IMAGEINFO: The new image will replace the old image
EDIT_DELETEINFO: If you really want to delete your station, please type your current password - all measurements will be deleted as well.
EDIT_DELETEERROR: Could not delete your senseBox, please contact us via email
DOWNLOAD_INTRO:
You can download data from senseBoxes that you see on the map. Move or zoom the map to change your selection, then select a timeframe and phenomenon that you want to download. The file format is CSV, downloading the data might take some time.
Daily data dumps can be found in our Archive.
DOWNLOAD_WARNING:
Downloading data from {{ count }} stations*
* Not all stations might have data in the selected time period. Use the Filter to find boxes and sensors that you want.
DOWNLOAD_NODATA: There is no data in the selected time frame.
COMMON_ERROR: An error occured. Please try again later.
SAF_INTRO: Select criteria by which you want to filter stations. When you change the time frame and phenomenon in combination with the time frame, a new set of senseBoxes will be fetched from the server, this might take some time. Searching for senseBoxes by name, group, exposure and phenomenon (without timeframe) is instantaneous.
SAF_HELP: Click 'Apply Filter' to apply your filter settings
NO_RESULTS: Unfortunately, there were no results matching your filters.
INTERP_INTRO: Here you can visualize senseBox measurement data for areas. The Inverse Distance Weighting algorithm is used.
INTERP_PLEASEFILTER: Please filter markers by date and phenomenon first under Filters
INTERP_INFO: Select an exact date (somewhere in your filter date range), we will try to find boxes around that time that have measurements according to your filters.
INTERP_IDWPARAM: Select the p-parameter for the IDW interpolation:
INTERP_NOTENOUGH: There aren't enough senseBoxes on the map
CHART_NODATA: There is no data for this sensor
BOX_BOXDETAILSINFO: Some information about this senseBox is shown here. This senseBox owner has not yet provided additional information.
CUSTOMBOX:
Here you can set up your own senseBox. Add sensors to your setup and specify their phenomenon (what is being measured?), unit and type (component name).
A temperature sensor might look like this:
  • Phenomenon: Temperature
  • Unit: °C
  • Type: LM35
CUSTOMBOX_SENSORINCOMPLETE: Your sensor setup is incomplete, please check if you have filled all fields (phenomenon, unit and type)
REG_HARDWAREINCOMPLETE: Your hardware setup is incomplete, please select a model
ACCOUNT_DELETE_INFO: If you delete your account, all your senseBoxes and measurements will be deleted.
ACCOUNT_DELETE_ACTION: To delete your account, please type your current password.
TTN_DESCRIPTION: openSenseMap offers an integration with TheThingsNetwork. Documentation for the parameters is provided on GitHub
TTN_INVALID_DECODEOPTS: Decode Options have to be a valid JSON array! The exact format documentation is linked above.
NOTIFICATION_PASSWORD_NOT_THE_SAME: Please make both new passwords the same.
NOTIFICATION_PASSWORD_UPDATE_SUCCESS: Password succesfully updated. You will be redirected in 5 seconds and please log in with your new password.
NOTIFICATION_USER_ACCOUNT_DELETE_SUCCESS: Account successfully deleted. You will be redirected in 5 seconds to the explore view.
NOTIFICATION_USER_ACCOUNT_DELETE_FAILED: Dein Benutzerkonto konnte nicht gelöscht werden
EDIT_IMAGETOBIG: The selected image is to big. Please select a image smaller than 500kb.
REGISTERED_BOXES_INFO: Create a new senseBox by clicking register or check out our documentation.
CREATE_NEW_SENSEBOX_INFO: You need an account to create a new senseBox. Please fill out the form to create an account. Afterwards you can create a new senseBox. If you already have an account log in to create one.
CHART_TOOLTIP_PLACEHOLDER: For details move the mouse over the datapoints
